messages.content: Nick Nolte appears in which Walter Hill movies?
Nick Nolte has appeared in three movies directed by Walter Hill: "48 Hrs." (1982), "Extreme Prejudice" (1987), and "Trespass" (1992).
Ry Cooder made music for which Walter Hill movies?

Ry Cooder has made music for several Walter Hill movies. They include:

- "The Long Riders" (1980)
- "Southern Comfort" (1981)
- "Streets of Fire" (1984)
- "Crossroads" (1986)
- "Johnny Handsome" (1989)
- "Trespass" (1992)

Cooder's distinctive guitar-based soundtracks were an important part of the mood and atmosphere of these films.
What is the basic plot of "Paint Your Wagon"?

"Paint Your Wagon" is a 1969 Western musical film directed by Joshua Logan. The film is set in a California mining camp during the Gold Rush era. The story follows prospector Ben Rumson (played by Lee Marvin) and his daughter Jennifer (played by Elizabeth Lerner), who arrive in the camp and discover gold. The two men then decide to go into business together, forming a partnership to mine for gold.

As they work together, they also become involved in a love triangle with Jennifer, who is courted by both men. The situation becomes more complicated when a Mormon family arrives in the camp, including a young woman named Elizabeth (played by Jean Seberg) whom Jennifer befriends. The two women then become involved in their own romantic entanglements, further complicating the situation.

Throughout the film, the characters sing and dance to a number of catchy songs, including "They Call the Wind Maria" and "I Talk to the Trees". The film is noted for its colorful characters, humorous tone, and memorable musical numbers.
